Detailed Description

A class for streaming video from a scribbler robot.

The class is used to stream video from the robot and apply filters to the video stream, so that the effects can be seen in real time.

Author:
Richard Edwards
John Hoare

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

VideoStream::VideoStream ( Scribbler *  scrib,
int  color_mode 
)
Parameters:
scrib - A pointer to a scribbler robot instance.
color_mode - 0 If the stream is operating in gray scale 1 if the stream is operating in RGB color space, and 2 if the robot is taking blob images.
VideoStream::VideoStream ( Scribbler &  scrib,
int  color_mode 
)
Parameters:
scrib - A reference to a scribbler robot instance.
color_mode - 0 If the stream is operating in gray scale 1 if the stream is operating in RGB color space, and 2 if the robot is taking blob images.

Member Function Documentation

int VideoStream::addFilter ( Filter *  filter  ) 

Used to add a filter to the video stream's filter list.

Note filters can be added at anytime to the video stream, even during streaming.

Returns:
The index at which the filter was stored in the video stream filter vector.
int VideoStream::delFilter ( int  filter_location  ) 

Used to delete a filter from the video stream's filter list at a specified index.

Returns:
0 for success, -1 for invalid index.
void VideoStream::endStream (  ) 

Stops the VideoStream.

Stops all the associated threads and closes the image window.

void VideoStream::startStream (  ) 

Starts the stream in the background.

Note, this function should not be called if the scrib instance has not successfully connected to a scribbler robot.
